review: This is a great device for streaming and screen sharing. I have two of them: one for the family room and one for the bedroom. I use mine mostly for video streaming of Hulu Plus, Netflix, MGO, VUDU, Google Play, Flixster, YouTube, and Disney Anywhere. I also like the screen sharing ability from my Nexus Tablet. I occasionally read digital books to my 3 children; screen sharing to the big TV screen makes it easier and more fun. As for photo viewing from iOS, I back up my photos to Google+ and view the pics from there. The same goes for videos. All this takes place natively from my Nexus tablet (audio and video). It also works well for audio streaming using Pandora and Google Play.Negatives:The biggest problem I have is the mandatory use of an app rather than the option of a separate remote. For example, I must have the Netflix app loaded on my remote device (tablet, phone) to load it to the Chromecast. This isn't a big deal, but sometimes it creates an inconvenience.This is a great device for the cost.

review: It was a little more difficult to setup than expected, but aside from that it's been very convenient. I tried the Fire TV stick and was extremely disappointed by its performance and functionality. Between my Android devices and the Chromecast I can stream everything except Amazon videos to my TV (the selection is slimmer than Netflix and I can still use my Roku LT for Amazon video anyway). If you have Android devices and don't care about streaming Amazon video to your TV then the Chromecast is a good purchase.
